abstract: Initializes MapKit JS by providing an authorization callback function and optional language.
overview:
## Discussion

Unless you wish to explicitly control initialization timing in JavaScript, use `data-token` instead of this method. See [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/loading-the-latest-version-of-mapkit-js] for more information.

If you’re using this method, provide the token by setting [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MapKitInitializationOptions/authorizationCallback] on a JavaScript object as a function. The [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MapKitInitializationOptions/authorizationCallback] function calls `done()` to return the token. [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/creating-a-maps-token] shows how to create Maps tokens.

When you create a server endpoint to deliver new tokens to MapKit JS, make an asynchronous request to this endpoint in your [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MapKitInitializationOptions/authorizationCallback] function and call `done()` with the result. The following example shows creating a callback that requests a token from a server endpoint and sets a preferred language for the map:

If you don’t set up a server endpoint, you can alternatively set [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MapKitInitializationOptions/authorizationCallback] to a function that provides a pregenerated token string.

An instance of [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/mapkit] emits a `configuration-change` event after MapKit JS initializes, and an `error` event when initialization fails. You can learn more about both of these events in [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/handling-initialization-events].

items.description: Respond to events that trigger when MapKit JS initializes.
items.name: Handling initialization events

items.description: A string that describes the list of loaded libraries.
items.name: loadedLibraries

items.description: Tells MapKit JS which libraries to load.
items.name: load(libraryNames)

title: init(options)
